sense.name: command
sense.commentary: a command given by a superior that must be obeyed (often plural)(often from a military superior or law enforcement officer)
sense.examples: The British ships dropped anchor and waited for orders form London. A friend in New Mexico said that the order caused no trouble out there. Allowing cats into George and Fido's new club is a violation of club orders.

sense.name: order of magnitude
sense.commentary: "order of" a degree in a continuum of size or quantity
sense.examples: It was on the order of a mile. An explosion of low order of magnitude

sense.name: lawfulness
sense.examples: Order ruled in the streets after the new mayor got to work. Law and order... The judge shouted "order in the court".

sense.name: arrangement
sense.commentary: ordering, ordination - logical or comprehensible arrangement of separate elements
sense.examples: We shall consider these questions in the inverse order of their presentation. There were mistakes in the ordering of items on the list.

sense.name: neatness
sense.commentary: a condition of regular or proper arrangement
sense.examples: He put his desk in order. The machine is now in working order.

sense.name: purchase
sense.commentary: a request for some supply for payment
sense.examples: IBM received an order for a hundred computers. The food arrived quickly once we gave the waiter our order.

sense.name: club
sense.examples: Men from the fraternal order will staff the soup kitchen today. The order of Saint Benedict... Theologians still disagree over whether 'bishop' should or should not be a separate order.

sense.name: taxonomic group
sense.commentary: taxonomic group containing one or more families
sense.examples: Cetacea is a scientific order which includes whales. All dolphins, porpoises, and whales are grouped together in the same scientific order.

sense.name: greek style
sense.commentary: one of original three styles of Greek architecture distinguished by the type of column and entablature used or a style developed from the original three by the Romans
sense.examples: The Ionic order of architecture is very similar to the Doric order.
